metadata.title: CVE-2023-52622 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ext4:avoid online resizing failures due to oversized flex bg When we onlineresize an ext4 filesystem with a oversized flexbg_size, mkfs.ext4 -F -G67108864 $dev -b 4096 100M mount $dev $dir resize2fs $dev 16G the followingWARN_ON is triggered:================================================================== WARNING:CPU: 0 PID: 427 at mm/page_alloc.c:4402 __alloc_pages+0x411/0x550 Moduleslinked in: sg(E) CPU: 0 PID: 427 Comm: resize2fs Tainted: G E 6.6.0-rc5+#314 RIP: 0010:__alloc_pages+0x411/0x550 Call Trace: <TASK>__kmalloc_large_node+0xa2/0x200 __kmalloc+0x16e/0x290ext4_resize_fs+0x481/0xd80 __ext4_ioctl+0x1616/0x1d90 ext4_ioctl+0x12/0x20__x64_sys_ioctl+0xf0/0x150 do_syscall_64+0x3b/0x90================================================================== This isbecause flexbg_size is too large and the size of the new_group_data arrayto be allocated exceeds MAX_ORDER. Currently, the minimum value ofMAX_ORDER is 8, the minimum value of PAGE_SIZE is 4096, the correspondingmaximum number of groups that can be allocated is: (PAGE_SIZE << MAX_ORDER)/ sizeof(struct ext4_new_group_data) â‰ˆ 21845 And the value that isdown-aligned to the power of 2 is 16384. Therefore, this value is definedas MAX_RESIZE_BG, and the number of groups added each time does not exceedthis value during resizing, and is added multiple times to complete theonline resizing. The difference is that the metadata in a flex_bg may bemore dispersed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-106-generic - 5.15.0-106.116
linux-image-5.15.0-106-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-106.116
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-generic - 5.15.0-106.116
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-generic-64k - 5.15.0-106.116
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1058-kvm - 5.15.0-1058.63
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1063-azure - 5.15.0-1063.72
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1063-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1063.72.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1059-gcp - 5.15.0-1059.67
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1058-gke - 5.15.0-1058.63
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1044-gkeop - 5.15.0-1044.51
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1054-ibm - 5.15.0-1054.57
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-lowlatency - 5.15.0-106.116
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-106.116
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1054-nvidia - 5.15.0-1054.55
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1054-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1054.55
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-oem - 6.5.0-1022.23
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-106.116').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5').
linux-hwe-6.5 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
